نهادن: to put; to place; to lay; to set
نوایی: the pen-name of Nizam al-Din Alisher Harawi (1441–1501), a Timurid poet.
نوروز: Nowruz (New Year in the Iranian/Zoroastrian calendar, celebrated on the spring equinox)
نوشید: third-person singular preterite indicative of نوشیدن (nušidan)
نگاشت: map, mapping (of one value to another)
هجران: a separation or remoteness from one's friend, beloved, or homeland
هزینه: cost (sum exchanged for a product or service)
هستند: third-person plural present of بودن (budan, “to be”); (they) are
هستیم: first-person plural present of بودن (budan, “to be”); (we) are
همدان: Hamadan (a city in Iran, the seat of Hamadan County's Central District and the capital of Hamadan Province)
ویستا: a female given name, Vista, from Avestan
پاتوق: hangout, haunt; favorite place one goes regularly
پاریس: Paris (the capital and largest city of France)
پالیز: orchard; a garden where fruits are grown
پامیر: Pamir (a mountain range in Central Asia)
پاگشا: Pagosha, a reception held for a recently-married couple according to traditional Iranian custom.
پرسید: third-person singular preterite indicative of پرسیدن (porsidan)
پرورش: breeding, nourishing, raising (e.g. of an animal)
پرویز: a male given name, Parviz or Parwez
پریدم: first-person singular preterite indicative of پریدن (paridan)
پشمام: an interjection of sheer surprise or shock, equivalent to "holy shit!".
پشمین: woolen (US) or woollen (UK); wooly (US) or woolly
پنجاب: Punjab (a geographical region in South Asia, politically divided between India and Pakistan)
پهلوی: ancient, pre-Islamic; of or relating to the age of the Iranian heroes before Islam
پوریا: a male given name, Pouria, Pooria, Pouriya, or Pooriya
پوشید: third-person singular preterite indicative of پوشیدن (pušidan)
پویان: a male given name, Pouyan or Pooyan
پژمان: a male given name, Pejman or Pezhman
پیشوا: one who is a model, someone whom others follow or imitate, guide, exemplar, initiator, instructor
چارلز: a transliteration of the English male given name Charles
چسبید: third-person singular preterite indicative of چسبیدن (časbidan)
چندان: so, so much; that (to such a degree)
کابلی: Kabuli (of or related to the city of Kabul)
کاسنی: chicory (any Cichorium plant and especially Cichorium intybus)
کانال: canal (waterway used for transportation of vessels)
کباده: bow-like metal equipment used for exercise
کتابی: belonging to or related to a book
کراچی: Karachi (the largest city in Pakistan situated along the Arabian Sea, as well as the provincial capital of Sindh Province)
کرایه: fare (money paid for a transport ticket)
کربلا: Karbala (a city in central Iraq, site of the murder of Husayn ibn Ali and major pilgrimage destination for Shiite Muslims)
کردند: third-person plural past indicative of کردن (kardan)
کردید: second-person plural past indicative of کردن (kardan)
کردیم: first-person plural past indicative of کردن (kardan)
کرمان: Kerman (a city in Iran, the seat of Kerman County's Central District and the capital of Kerman Province)
کریمه: Crimea (a geographic region and peninsula in Eastern Europe, jutting out into the Black Sea; de facto occupied and annexed in 2014 as a republic of Russia, but internationally recognized as an autonomous republic of Ukraine :)
کشتند: third-person plural preterite indicative of کشتن (koštan)
کشتید: second-person plural preterite indicative of کشتن (koštan)
کشتیم: first-person plural preterite indicative of کشتن (koštan)
کشمیر: Kashmir (a contested geographic region of South Asia in the northern part of the Indian subcontinent, located between (and de facto divided between) India, Pakistan and China)
کشیدن: to pull, to drag, to haul
کشیده: a slap given with the open hand
کلکته: Kolkata (the capital city of West Bengal, India, formerly known in English as Calcutta)
کنکور: Konkur (the national university entrance examination in Iran)
کوفتن: to break, bruise, knock, strike, smite, beat, thrash, shake, trample under foot, tread upon
کوهان: the hump of a camel, zebu, etc.
کویته: Quetta (a city, the provincial capital of Balochistan, Pakistan).
گذاشت: third-person singular preterite indicative of گذاشتن (gozâštan)
گذشتن: to pass, to pass away (especially of time)
گردون: wheel (Any circular device which rotates on its axis.)
گرفتم: first-person singular preterite indicative of گرفتن (gereftan)
گرفتی: second-person singular preterite indicative of گرفتن (gereftan)
گسستن: to split; to take apart; to disconnect
گفتید: second-person plural past indicative of گفتن (goftan)
گفتیم: first-person plural past indicative of گفتن (goftan)
گلاره: a female given name, Gelareh or Glareh, from Southern Kurdish
گلچهر: having a face as beautiful as a rose
گنجوی: related to the city of Ganja
گودرز: Gotarzes (the name of two Parthian kings)
یاسوج: Yasuj (a city in Iran, the seat of Boyer-Ahmad County's Central District and the capital of Kohgiluyeh and Boyer-Ahmad Province)
یعقوب: a male given name from Arabic يَعْقُوب (yaʕqūb) in turn from Classical Syriac ܝܥܩܘܒ, in turn from Hebrew יעקב, equivalent to English Jacob or James
یقینا: indeed, definitely, for sure, surely, undoubtedly
